item.title: 地热初创企业 Fervo 吸引了包括谷歌在内的新投资者
item.description: 美国地热初创公司 Fervo Energy 利用地球热能发电的技术，从一批新老投资者那里筹集了 4.62 亿美元。【原文：Fervo Energy, the US geothermal startup whose technology uses the earth’s heat to generate power, raised $462 million from a group of new and existing investors.】

item.title: 欧盟禁令存疑，汽车制造商看好燃油汽车前景
item.description: 据熟悉内燃机技术的人士透露，由于预计欧盟将收回对内燃机技术的禁令，多家欧洲汽车制造商及其供应商正准备让内燃机汽车重获新生。【原文：Several European automakers and their suppliers are preparing to give cars with a combustion engine a new lease on life, based on expectations that the European Union will walk back its planned ban of the technology, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 优步退出电动汽车领域，削减对司机的奖励
item.description:
长期以来，Uber 一直在推动政府制定政策，加快电动汽车的普及速度，如今，Uber 支持特朗普的电动汽车立法。【原文：

After long pushing for government policies to speed adoption of electric cars, Uber embraced Trump's EV-battering legislation. 

】

item.title: Uber Courts Trump as It Falls Behind on Its Green Policies
item.description: 优步（Uber）和其他共享出行公司立下宏大志向，要帮助他们的司机过渡到电动汽车。但在整个企业界，这样的故事越来越常见，它们现在在气候承诺上出现了倒退。【原文：Uber and other rideshare companies set grand ambitions to help their drivers transition to electric vehicles. But in a story that’s becoming increasingly common across the corporate world, they’re now backsliding on their climate commitments.】

item.title: 澳大利亚各州颁发 2018 年以来首批天然气勘探许可证
item.description: 澳大利亚维多利亚州正在进行七年来的首次石油勘探招标，以避免现有油田产量下降带来的天然气供应风险。【原文：The Australian state of Victoria is going ahead with its first petroleum exploration tenders in seven years in an attempt to head off looming gas supply risks as production from existing fields declines.】

item.title: 亚洲能源需求激增，弃煤策略失灵
item.description: 煤炭在亚洲的前景正变得更加光明，因为这个亚洲最大的能源消费地区在努力向清洁能源转型的过程中遭遇了一系列挫折。【原文：Coal’s future in Asia is looking brighter, as the top-consuming region’s efforts to shift to cleaner energy suffer a series of setbacks.】

item.title: 欧盟达成临时协议，设定 2040 年减排 90% 的目标
item.description: 欧盟达成一项协议，到 2040 年将温室气体排放量比 1990 年减少 90%，这一目标旨在使欧盟在本世纪中叶实现净零排放。【原文：The European Union clinched a deal to reduce greenhouse gases by 90% through 2040 compared with 1990 levels, a target that seeks to keep the bloc on track to reach net zero by the middle of the century.】

item.title: 核能与化石燃料联手削弱可再生能源
item.description:
这个曾经不太可能的联盟在得克萨斯州生根发芽，现在已经深入白宫，特朗普总统希望在白宫禁止风能项目。【原文：

The once unlikely alliance took root in Texas and now reaches right into the White House, where President Trump wants to ban wind energy projects.

】

item.title: 加州再次推迟住宅野火保护规定
item.description:
州政府官员表示，对减少危房周围植被的拟议任务的反弹正在阻碍这一进程。【原文：

State officials say pushback against proposed mandates to reduce vegetation around at-risk houses is stalling the process. 

】

item.title: 津巴布韦将于明年开始建设浮动太阳能项目
item.description: 津巴布韦计划明年开始在世界上最大的人工湖上建造一座浮动太阳能发电厂。【原文：Zimbabwe plans to start building a floating solar plant on the world’s largest human-made lake next year.】

item.title: 印度尼西亚将对违反森林许可证的矿工处以巨额罚款
item.description: 印尼将对在森林许可范围之外非法采矿的矿工处以高额罚款，这是总统普拉博沃-苏比安托（Prabowo Subianto）打击该行业的最新举措。【原文：Indonesia will slap hefty fines on miners that have illegally operated beyond their forest permits, the latest move by President Prabowo Subianto as he cracks down on the sector.】

item.title: 家庭气候风险评分的不完美科学性
item.description: Zillow 的气候风险评分已经从房屋列表中消失，但风险本身是真实存在的。不过，将这些威胁建模到房屋层面是一项挑战。【原文：Zillow’s climate risk scores have disappeared from home listings, but the risks themselves are very real. Modeling those threats down to the home level, though, is challenging.】

item.title: Zillow 删除房屋气候风险评分揭示洪水和火灾数据的局限性
item.description:
业主和购房者需要更多有关气候危险的信息。但是，即使是专家也很难准确定位这些危险。【原文：

Property owners and buyers need more information on climate dangers. But pinpointing them is hard, even for experts. 

】

item.title: 为什么预计 2026 年全球电池价格将再次下降？
item.description:
预计该技术将克服关税和高昂的金属成本，从而节省新的成本，并有助于推动电动汽车和储能系统的采用。【原文：

The technology is forecast to overcome tariffs and high metal costs to win new savings and help drive adoption of electric vehicles and energy storage systems.

】

item.title: 航运王朝和皇室支持现代风帆以降低燃料成本
item.description: 亚洲和挪威的航运王朝是支持现代风帆技术的投资者之一，该技术声称有可能减少船只所需的燃料量。【原文：Asian and Norwegian shipping dynasties are among investors offering support for modern-day sail technology that claims to have potential to slash the amount of fuel needed by vessels.】

item.title: 英国气象局警告说，"生命危险 "天气警报已在暴风雨布拉姆中发布
item.description: 在 "布拉姆 "风暴的影响下，英国气象局针对苏格兰、威尔士和英格兰西南部部分地区的风雨天气发布了多个 "危及生命 "的天气预警。【原文：The Met Office has issued several "danger to life" weather warnings for rain and wind in parts of Scotland, Wales and south-west England amid Storm Bram.】

item.title: 智库称中国清洁能源对外投资激增
item.description: 据气候能源金融公司（Climate Energy Finance）称，随着中国政府利用其在能源转型技术方面的优势，去年中国在绿色电力领域的外商投资跃升至 800 亿美元。【原文：Chinese foreign investment in green power jumped to $80 billion in the past year as Beijing leveraged its dominance in energy transition technologies, according to Climate Energy Finance.】

item.title: 网格技术股正在飙升。这就是原因。
item.description: 人工智能的蓬勃发展正在产生连锁反应。我们已经看到人们对核能和地热能的兴趣急剧上升。现在，你可以把电网技术添加到列表中。【原文：The AI boom is having a ripple effect. We’ve seen interest in nuclear and geothermal energy spike. Now, you can add grid tech to the list.】

item.title: 能源影响合伙公司（Energy Impact Partners）在人工智能热潮中收购清洁技术公司
item.description:
其创始人兼执行合伙人表示，太阳能、电池和其他能源公司的估值降低 "现在更有意义"。【原文：

Its founder and managing partner said that lower valuations for solar, battery and other energy companies “make a lot more sense now.”

】

item.title: 网格科技股有望在人工智能泡沫担忧中进一步飙升
item.description:
为电网提供服务的公司正在迅猛发展，摩根大通和其他机构的分析师认为，在人工智能热潮和电气化的推动下，这一趋势仍将持续。【原文：

Companies that service power grids are surging, and analysts at JPMorgan and elsewhere see that trend continuing amid the AI boom and push for electrification.

】

item.title: 印尼洪灾后预计重建费用将达 30 亿美元
item.description: 据印尼国家救灾机构称，印尼将需要51.8万亿印尼盾（32亿美元）来重建苏门答腊岛最近遭受洪水和山体滑坡破坏的地区。【原文：Indonesia will need 51.8 trillion rupiah ($3.2 billion) to rebuild areas devastated by recent floods and landslides in Sumatra, according to the national disaster agency.】

item.title: 协会称中国钢铁过剩问题难以解决
item.description: 世界钢铁协会负责人表示，中国顽固的钢铁产能过剩问题不容易解决，因为该行业与中国更广泛的经济密切相关。【原文：China’s stubborn steel overcapacity won’t be easy to fix because the industry is so deeply intertwined with the country’s broader economy, according to the head of the World Steel Association.】

item.title: 大气河将在本周五淹没西北太平洋地区
item.description: 一场被称为 "大气河 "的巨大太平洋风暴将从下周一开始从海洋席卷至西北太平洋地区，给包括西雅图和波特兰在内的整个地区带来暴雨和为期一周的洪水、河水暴涨甚至大雪。【原文：A massive Pacific storm called an atmospheric river will sweep off the ocean into the Pacific Northwest starting Monday, bringing heavy rain and a week of floods, swollen rivers and even heavy snow across the region, including Seattle and Portland.】

item.title: 美国房主急于获得即将到期的太阳能税收抵免造成瓶颈
item.description: 今年早些时候，特朗普政府取消了电动汽车税收抵免政策，美国汽车制造商迎来了购买热潮。随着屋顶太阳能和电池税收抵免将于本月底结束，同样的情况再次发生。【原文：When the Trump administration wiped out electric vehicle tax credits earlier this year, the US automakers saw a rush of buyers. With rooftop solar and battery tax credits set to wind down at the end of this month, the same thing is happening again.】

item.title: 房主有可能错过太阳能税收抵免。这就是原因。
item.description:
人们急于在12月31日前安装住宅太阳能和电池系统，以获得即将到期的30%美国税收抵免。但安装人员表示，漫长的许可时间正在危及这一机会。【原文：

There's a rush to install residential solar and battery systems by Dec. 31 to qualify for expiring 30% US tax credits. But lengthy permitting times are jeopardizing the opportunity, installers say.

】

item.title: 欧盟六国呼吁放弃 2035 年内燃机禁令
item.description: 包括意大利的乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）在内的六位欧盟领导人要求欧盟委员会提议软化该集团的汽车排放规则，以停止计划在下一个十年中期对内燃机实施的事实上的禁令。【原文：Six European Union leaders including Italy’s Giorgia Meloni asked the European Commission to propose softening the bloc’s vehicle emission rules to halt a de-facto ban on combustion engines planned by the middle of the next decade.】

item.title: 纽约在破纪录的低温下瑟瑟发抖
item.description: 一股冰冷的加拿大空气使整个东北部气温骤降，刷新了纽约市区的日气温记录，并使华盛顿特区的司机们在傍晚通勤时面临严峻考验。【原文：A wave of icy-cold Canadian air sent temperatures tumbling across the Northeast, upending daily records in New York’s metro area and setting up Washington, DC, drivers for a tough evening commute.】

item.title: 史蒂文-吉尔伯特为何离开马克-卡尼的内阁
item.description: 加拿大总理马克-卡尼上任已近九个月。他花了数年时间在全球舞台上建立自己的气候信誉。但自上任以来，他对化石燃料的态度变得更加开放。【原文：Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is nearly nine months into his tenure. He spent years building his climate bona fides on the global stage. But since taking over the role, he’s become more open to fossil fuels.】

item.title: 电动汽车充电网络重新获得拜登奖金
item.description:
耗资 50 亿美元的充电站联邦计划在特朗普试图将其扼杀之后依然生机勃勃。【原文：

The $5 billion federal program for charging stations is very much alive, after Trump tried to kill it.

】

item.title: 卡尼叛逃者称加拿大现在不可能实现气候目标
item.description:
前部长史蒂文-吉尔博（Steven Guilbeault）说，政府最近的政策决定使其2030年、2035年甚至2050年的目标遥不可及。【原文：

Ex-minister Steven Guilbeault said the government’s recent policy decisions put its targets for 2030, 2035 and even 2050 out of reach. 

】
